SENT.plain: A 54-year-old man developed left hemiparesis and tactile and deep sensory disturbance following onset of rightside cervical pain
These symptoms resulted from an isolated infarct in the right medial area of the upper medulla oblongata and intracranial vertebral artery (VA) dissection
Atherosclerotic disease of the VA is the most common cause of medial medullary infarction
In past reports of isolated medial medullary infarction, only a few cases involved VA dissection
